Ice::

She turned and looked at Lunarpine. "What little game is that? From 
what I've seen, this Veratis isn't a killer. He's not trying to harm 
anyone. But what I don't understand is this prophecy of his. He keeps 
thinking about it, but I can't see that far into his mind to really 
understand it. OK, Sure he can be grumpy. But what game are you 
refering to?" She was trying to keep her mind out of his.  She was 
controlling it so that she wasn't jst reading the minds of the bots 
near her. She would respect the thoughts of the other bots and not 
get into thier heads. That is unless it was absolutely nessasary.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> "It's OK, You did real good." Lunarpine smiled since he now knew 
where they
> stood. "He told me a little about the prophecy. It seems like it's 
almost a
> religion to him and his group. The three of them seem almost 
fanatical about
> it." He walked past her a little, his back was now to her, "Let's 
play thier
> little game and see just what the next move is." He didn't exactly 
trust the
> scientist but wanted to repay the debt he owed. If that meant 
pulling one of
> his group out of trouble then that's what he'd do. He wouldn't drag 
Ice into
> this battle though, he still thought of her as the recon bot that 
Shadow
> Wing had been.
> 
> Veratis stood up for a moment holding his head. "Is there a 
problem?"
> Inquired Foxfingers as he placed a hand on his meantors back. 
Veratis
> glanced around the room, trying to regain his equilibreum, "I just 
got dizzy
> for a moment it's nothing to worry about."
> 
> The Protoform with the Raptor DNA was nearly complete. Veratis had 
hoped
> that the spark inside could be taught the ways of Prime. Time would 
tell
> just who or what would become of the new translife form.
>
